data.title: Initialize hat values for mapping and revert X360 mappings.
data.body:
Issue #6419 is caused by uninitialized values for the hat JoyEvents.  An uninitialized value of 0 for the index causes the hat event to be interpreted as button 0.

I've initialized the hat indices to larger integer buttons, so they won't overlap with normal buttons.  From my reading of the code, I don't think this should cause any issues, but let me know if I've missed something.

I've also reverted the X360 mappings to match SDL, as they will work properly now.  I also added my X360 controller, as it was missing from the mappings.

data.title: The remote tree inspector is choking on huge amount of nodes, even when not expanded
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727

I have a scene containing a procedurally-generated terrain, which generates a lot of nodes under a specific parent.
When the remote tree inspector is enabled, it immediately freezes the editor and the game for a few seconds and repeats regularly, even if the parent holding the huge amount of nodes is not expanded.

It would be nice if the remote inspector didn't try to get all nodes in the scene at once, but only those it needs.

data.title: [2.1] Dictionary copy-on-write can cause invalid memory accesses due to undefined subexpression ordering
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - Godot 2.1 - VS2017

**Issue description:**
I ran into a problem with an optimized 64-bit build built with VS2017: Capsules were always radius 0.

The problem turned out to be this line in CapsuleShapeSW::set_data:
`_setup(d["height"], d["radius"]);`

Because C++ doesn't create a sequence point between parameters, the compiler can evaluate the parameters and their subexpressions (including the float conversions) in any order it feels like as long is the dependencies are in order.  The new VS C++ code generator apparently likes to schedule calls of the same function together, so now it emits that line as the equivalent of:

`Variant& temp1 = d["radius"];`
`Variant& temp2 = d["height"];`
`float temp3 = temp1.operator float();`
`float temp4 = temp2.operator float();`
`_setup(temp4, temp3);`

"d" is mutable, and indexing a mutable dictionaries always copies and deletes the original if it's unreferenced elsewhere, so by the time temp1 is converted, the lookup of "height" has already invalidated the memory location looked up from "radius", and the case I was seeing, its type was stomped with 0.

So, this might not be a problem in 3.0 since that functionality is gone in master, but it can affect 2.1.  It's hard to really tell how widespread it is, but searching for [" yields a decent number of cases.

The simplest solution I think is to just make dictionaries not copy if their reference count is 1, which would prevent it from relocating its contents after the first access as long as none of the other accesses insert a key.  It should probably do anyway since right now it's doing a copy of the entire dictionary on every mutable access.

data.title: Add "On Top" flag to Sprite3D (2.1)
data.body: Adds "On Top" flag to Sprite3D.  Useful for creating FX sprites that always appear in front of other sprites and don't clip into objects, markers that show through solids, and possibly other things.

data.title: How can I intergrate other OpenGL render library into godot?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 with GLES3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

I'm trying to intergrate [NanoVG](https://github.com/memononen/nanovg) as a Control to draw vertor graphics like this. 

```c++
#include "nano_canvas.h"
#define NANOVG_GLES3_IMPLEMENTATION
#include <thirdparty/glad/glad/glad.h>
#include "nanovg/nanovg_gl.h"

NanoCanvas::NanoCanvas():Control() {
    m_pNVGContext = nvgCreateGLES3(NVG_ANTIALIAS);
}

void NanoCanvas::_notification(int p_notification) {
    switch (p_notification) {
        case NOTIFICATION_DRAW: {
                nvgBeginFrame(m_pNVGContext,300,300,1.0);
                nvgBeginPath(m_pNVGContext);
                nvgRect(m_pNVGContext, 100,100, 120,30);
                nvgFillColor(m_pNVGContext, nvgRGBA(255,192,0,255));
                nvgFill(m_pNVGContext);
                nvgEndFrame(m_pNVGContext);
        }
        break;
    }
}
```

But I get some render errors below:
```
mesege
```

data.title: Input: Remove usage of platform dependent event IDs.
data.body:
The `ID` property for InputEvents is set by `SceneTree` when sending the event down the tree.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L388
So there's no need for the platform specific code to set this value when it will later be overriden anyway...

data.title: [3.0] Image::_get_pixelb bugged?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
N/A - current master

**Issue description:**
Possible bug in Image::_get_pixelb:
```
void Image::_get_pixelb(int p_x, int p_y, uint32_t p_pixelsize, const uint8_t *p_src, uint8_t *p_dst) {

	uint32_t ofs = (p_y * width + p_x) * p_pixelsize;

	for (uint32_t i = 0; i < p_pixelsize; i++) {
		p_dst[ofs] = p_src[ofs + i]; // <<<<<<<<<<<<
	}
}
```
i think:
`p_dst[ofs] = p_src[ofs + i];`
 should be:
`p_dst[i] = p_src[ofs + i];`

**Steps to reproduce:**
N/A

**Link to minimal example project:**
why i need that private member?:
https://godotengine.org/qa/13482

data.title: [3.0] Texture color is randomly becoming brighter or darker, or different
data.body:
Godot 3.0 af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits, nVidia GeForce 940M

When upgrading a project, I found that textured meshes were randomly getting different colors than expected. Most of the time, they become brighter, either in the game, or in the editor. Sometimes they become darker but I've seen that only in the inspector yet. The texture is uncompressed and has no flags checked.

Toggling lights or changing nodes order had one-time effects on this, but it's still pretty random so I don't know how, when or why this happens.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24328407/5d256e8a-11e9-11e7-85c7-78dddd6046ce.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24328413/6f7b6dbe-11e9-11e7-8718-300d9f3e520b.png)

I've also found that if I remove all lights and WorldEnvironment, I get a blue color:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24328430/b5dc5516-11e9-11e7-931a-9a1aadfc07dd.png)

The texture:
![terrain](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24328433/d604f316-11e9-11e7-9360-ba1b609f41e9.png)

Project of the second screenshot:
[TextureColorBug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/870557/TextureColorBug.zip)

data.title: [3.0] Texture .flags file is still present
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits

When I created a new 3.0 project, I noticed the default icon.png came with an icon.png.import file, but also an icon.png.flags file. These should have been superseded by .import files.

data.title: CollisionShapes cannot be rotated
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits

Create a KinematicBody, then a CollisionShape with a CapsuleShape. Rotating the CollisionShape seems to have no effect. Rotating the body doesn't either. It is working in 2.1.2.
If you select another node then the CollisionShape again, the visual updates and shows the rotated shape.
However, that's not only a visual issue: I just tested a character controller and I get stuck earlier in one direction rather than another, suggesting that my capsule is still badly oriented.

A workaround is to rotate the shapes with a script instead:
```gdscript
	set_shape_transform(0, Transform().rotated(Vector3(1,0,0), PI/2.0))
```

data.title: [2.1] Better handling of joypad device IDs.
data.body: Backport of #7862 to 2.1

data.title: Directories cannot be entered by selecting items from a FileDialog on Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: Android 7.1.1 / LineageOS 14.1
Godot: Godot 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
There is no way for me to choose a folder from the directory listing and make it the current directory. If I want to change the current directory I need to enter the directory name in the top bar.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Make a new project with just one scene that is a FileDialog, set to filesystem access and MODE_OPEN_FILE.
2) Go to the export menu for Android and make sure to enable the "Read External Storage" permission.
3) Deploy the project to an Android device.
4) Make sure the app has been given its permissions.
5) Open the app.
6) If the currently displayed directory is empty or only contains the parent directory link, use the top bar to navigate to "/sdcard" for on-device storage.
7) Try to change the current directory to one of the listed directories by choosing it from the menu. I have tried tapping, double tapping, and hitting "Open" after tapping a directory. None of these have changed the current directory.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[filetest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/870390/filetest.zip) (ZIP-exported Godot project)
[filetest-apk.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/870391/filetest-apk.zip) (Contains an exported APK)

data.title: Nodes on the Popup class should be able to steal focus on show for keyboard control
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: 2.1.2**


**Issue description:**
Popup don't grab focus on show, something really uncommon.
Also, everything loses focus on close, which is not common either.

An optional property to steal focus on show and a path to return it on hide will be good to have on the Popup node branch (or maybe deeper, like in WindowDialog) and may help to solve issues like #8149, also facilitating common key/pad menu navigation on games and other kind of programs.

I know this can be done by the programmer but such a common behavior I think should be there, like the "exclusive" property.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- On the example project, use up and down to enjoy keyboard navigation over the buttons.
- Press enter/return over the buttons that open Popup or FileDialog
- Continue enjoying keyboard navigation over the buttons while it should be somewhere else.

-------------

This can be quickly tested on the Project Manager too:
- Open the project manager and get focus on the buttons to the right.
- Open new, scan or import (with keyboard).
- Press up and down (some windows work almost fine, others not).

**Link to minimal example project:**
[focusissue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/870350/focusissue.zip)

data.title: Project Manager is not keyboard friendly
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: tested on 2.1.2 stable but may affect all builds**

**Issue description:**
Can't use keyboard on the Project Manager using all the options.
Keyboard shortcuts and common navigation (using arrows and tabs) is expected to work.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to use the project manager with keyboard to run, edit, import and create projects.

data.body:
Updating project repository,
added jcenter() since Android Studio uses it by default.

https://www.jfrog.com/knowledge-base/why-should-i-use-jcenter-over-maven-central/

data.title: Added ability to change A-star cost function
data.body:
Added _estimate_cost and _compute_cost to allow for both C++ and gdscript inheritance to customize the A-star cost function.

See discussion here for further information:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7932

data.title: Mouse Position is unknown until first mouse event
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux - Godot master (468719)

**Issue description:**
If you neither click nor move the mouse, `get_global_mouse_pos` wil return `(0,0)`.
Related to #8136.

**Steps to reproduce:**
```gdscript
extends Node2D

func _ready():
    print(get_global_mouse_pos()) # 0,0
```

data.title: Reworked change_dir to support symlinks
data.body:
Same as #7935
But I put it in a branch at my end so I can work on other stuff (accidentally had it in my master branch):
Original note for reference:

I have rewritten change_dir to support symlinks.
This works by allowing current_dir to diverge from what getcwd deems is the current directory as getcwd resolves symlinks to the actual real directory which we do not want to do.

This is a potential fix for #6539, #6047 and #5700

data.title: Reworked change_dir to support symlinks
data.body:
Same as https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7935
But I put it in a branch at my end so I can work on other stuff (accidentally had it in my master branch):
Original note for reference:


I have rewritten change_dir to support symlinks.
This works by allowing current_dir to diverge from what getcwd deems is the current directory as getcwd resolves symlinks to the actual real directory which we do not want to do.

This is a potential fix for #6539, #6047 and #5700

data.title: SCons: Add option to toggle warnings (on by default)
data.body:
All the warnings are factored out of the platform-specific files and moved to
SConstruct. Will have to check that it does not introduce regressions on some
platforms/compilers.

I'll cherry-pick for 2.1 if it proves to work on 2.1.3 pre-release builds.

data.title: Fix renderer sometimes not applying "unshaded" flag (2.1)
data.body: Fixes shading conditionals not being updated when 2 consecutive objects have the same receive shadow flag and light type, but different unshaded flags (example: a Sprite3D and a TestCube in a scene with no lights).

data.title: [3.0] Depth-of-field blur is applied on gizmos even when set far away
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 master a0b0dff6fdbdc4be78087aa572f3da5dbb8daa01
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia GeForce 940M

DoF is applied in the editor on the gizmos, at any distance, even if set far away. Meshes don't seem to be affected by the issue.

data.title: [3.0] The import dock doesn't update when a resource is accessed from the inspector
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 master af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits

When the little arrow on the right of a resource is clicked in the inspector, it shows the resource but the import dock doesn't updates.
It only does when the resource is double-clicked in the file explorer.
I expected it to work when resources are accessed from the inspector too.

data.title: [3.0] Game crashes if stretch mode is set  to "viewport"
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 master af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits

When I set the display stretch mode to "viewport", the game crashes as soon as I start it.
Setting the stretch mode to "2d" doesn't produce a crash but nothing is visible (2D or 3D), only the clear color.
Only no stretch mode works.

data.title: Input: Update mouse position on mouse-button events.
data.body: Fixes #8136.
